revision.text: {{WikiProject A Song of Ice and Fire|class=B|importance=low}} {{TelevisionWikiProject|class=B|importance=mid}} ==Did D.B. Weiss direct this episode?== The episode does credit David Benioff as the single director. However, all previous [http://www.accesshollywood.com/game-of-thrones-producers-david-benioff-and-db-weiss-to-direct-during-season-3_article_66580?__source=rss announcements] and HBO's own material realeased after the show (see [http://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/index.html#/game-of-thrones/episodes/3/23-walk-of-punishment/video/inside-the-episode.html/eNrjcmbOYM5nLtQsy0xJzXfMS8ypLMlMds7PK0mtKFHPz0mBCQUkpqf6JeamcjIyskknlpbkF+QkVtqWFJWmsjGyMQIAWCcXOA== Inside the episode]) say Weiss directed episode 3. The press and other sources appear to be divided in the matter. So... does anyone knows for sure whether Weiss should be credited as a director or not? I'm inclined towards crediting him, personally, if we don't get further confirmation. At least the three external links from the page agree: HBO, TV.com, and imdb.--[[User:RR|RR]] ([[User talk:RR|talk]]) 14:14, 15 April 2013 (UTC) :Unfortunately, IMDB is noted as an untrustworthy source and HBO counts as a primary one. If unsure, you can always state the sources conflict one another and give citations for both verions.'''—♦♦ [[User:Amberrock|''AMBER'']][[User talk:Amberrock|(ЯʘCK)]]''' 15:43, 15 April 2013 (UTC) ::Indeed, Benioff and Weiss directed the episode together. However, DGA dictates that only one person is credited for directing. [[User:Ddnixx|Ddnixx]] ([[User talk:Ddnixx|talk]]) 23:42, 18 April 2013 (UTC) :::Thanks. So that's why. I'll incorporate it into the article.--[[User:RR|RR]] ([[User talk:RR|talk]]) 16:10, 19 April 2013 (UTC) ==Episode screenshot listed for deletion== Right here: [[Wikipedia:Files for deletion/2013 April 15#File:GOT Walk of Punishment.jpg]]. Thought you guys might want to know and get your voice heard.'''—♦♦ [[User:Amberrock|''AMBER'']][[User talk:Amberrock|(ЯʘCK)]]''' 18:19, 15 April 2013 (UTC) ==I wonder of the names of the three prostitutes?== I believe many interested parties would like to know them. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:36.229.190.89|36.229.190.89]] ([[User talk:36.229.190.89|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/36.229.190.89|contribs]]) 07:43, 16 April 2013‎ == RfC on Oathkeeper == There's an RS RfC on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Oathkeeper#RfC:_Blog_source--usable_for_facts.3F Oathkeeper] talk page. Participation (and fresh voices) would be welcome. [[User:Darkfrog24|Darkfrog24]] ([[User talk:Darkfrog24|talk]]) 01:43, 16 August 2014 (UTC)
